{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "Stephanie Nicholas Solutions is a locally-owned company founded in 2019, specializing in providing professional cleaning services, facility management, building maintenance, fumigation, furnishing and finishing for companies and organizations.

Its mission is to create clean and healthy work spaces through world-class facility management and cleaning techniques, ensuring customer satisfaction with innovation and a hands-on approach.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused Cashier to accurately process customer transactions, handle cash and other payment methods, and provide excellent customer service in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Process customer transactions accurately and efficiently
	Handle cash, credit cards, and other payment methods
	Balance the cash register and reconcile any discrepancies
	Provide excellent customer service and resolve customer issues promptly
	Maintain a clean and organized workspace
	Meet sales targets and promote products or services as needed


Requirements


	Previous cash handling experience is preferred
	Excellent customer service skills
	Basic math skills with strong attention to accuracy
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
	Good communication skills.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 / month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to:&nbsp;snsolutions690@gmail.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Cashier&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the email
Or
Visit the office premises at:
68, Emma Abimbola Cole Street,
Lekki Phase 1, Lagos.
You can also call 08057835493.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-02",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-12",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Stephanie Nicholas Solutions"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

Cashier Job at Stephanie Nicholas Solutions




        
    

        
        Stephanie Nicholas Solutions is a locally-owned company founded in 2019, specializing in providing professional cleaning services, facility management, building maintenance, fumigation, furnishing and finishing for companies and organizations.

Its mission is to create clean and healthy work spaces through world-class facility management and cleaning techniques, ensuring customer satisfaction with innovation and a hands-on approach.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused Cashier to accurately process customer transactions, handle cash and other payment methods, and provide excellent customer service in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Process customer transactions accurately and efficiently
	Handle cash, credit cards, and other payment methods
	Balance the cash register and reconcile any discrepancies
	Provide excellent customer service and resolve customer issues promptly
	Maintain a clean and organized workspace
	Meet sales targets and promote products or services as needed


Requirements


	Previous cash handling experience is preferred
	Excellent customer service skills
	Basic math skills with strong attention to accuracy
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
	Good communication skills.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 / month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to: snsolutions690@gmail.com using “Cashier” as the subject of the email
Or
Visit the office premises at:
68, Emma Abimbola Cole Street,
Lekki Phase 1, Lagos.
You can also call 08057835493.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Associate",
  "description": "Temploy NG is a unique talent and skill recruitment service. We simplify temporary employment for organisations and busy individuals by&nbsp;matching them with the right people for skilled and semi-skilled work &ndash; for periods as short as one day, one week, one month or one year.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Ido, Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full-Time, Hybrid

Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and resourceful HR Associate to join our HR consulting firm.
	The ideal candidate will support recruitment, training, and advisory services, helping to deliver high-quality HR services to our clients.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, candidate screening, scheduling interviews, and maintaining candidate records.
	Support onboarding processes for new employees, including documentation, induction scheduling, and orientation.
	Maintain accurate HR records, employee files, and HR databases using approved digital HR systems.
	Assist in payroll preparation, leave management, and benefits administration in coordination with HR leadership.
	Support employee engagement initiatives, training programs, and performance management activities.
	Generate HR reports as required and ensure compliance with company policies and labor regulations.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Degree or Diploma in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field, with 1&ndash;2 years of post-NYSC relevant HR experience.
	Proficiency in HRIS platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, and digital HR tools.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Detail-oriented, highly organized, and capable of managing multiple HR priorities effectively.
	Discreet, professional, and able to maintain confidentiality at all times.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Note:&nbsp;Please apply only if you have the requirements and experience to deliver on the job.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-02",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Temploy Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193923"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Human Resources Associate Job at Temploy Limited




        
    

        
        Temploy NG is a unique talent and skill recruitment service. We simplify temporary employment for organisations and busy individuals by matching them with the right people for skilled and semi-skilled work – for periods as short as one day, one week, one month or one year.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Associate

Job Location: Ido, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time, Hybrid

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a proactive and resourceful HR Associate to join our HR consulting firm.
	The ideal candidate will support recruitment, training, and advisory services, helping to deliver high-quality HR services to our clients.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, candidate screening, scheduling interviews, and maintaining candidate records.
	Support onboarding processes for new employees, including documentation, induction scheduling, and orientation.
	Maintain accurate HR records, employee files, and HR databases using approved digital HR systems.
	Assist in payroll preparation, leave management, and benefits administration in coordination with HR leadership.
	Support employee engagement initiatives, training programs, and performance management activities.
	Generate HR reports as required and ensure compliance with company policies and labor regulations.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Degree or Diploma in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field, with 1–2 years of post-NYSC relevant HR experience.
	Proficiency in HRIS platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, and digital HR tools.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Detail-oriented, highly organized, and capable of managing multiple HR priorities effectively.
	Discreet, professional, and able to maintain confidentiality at all times.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Note: Please apply only if you have the requirements and experience to deliver on the job.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "AHM Resource Hub,&nbsp;HR Management &amp; Consulting&nbsp;is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a talented Social Media Manager to help us expand our digital footprint, oversee our social communications efforts and increase brand awareness and affinity.
	The ideal candidate will manage our company image in a cohesive way to achieve our marketing and branding goals. The candidate should be well-versed in the latest digital technologies and social media trends. The candidate should also have in-depth knowledge of SEO, analytics, and content management tools.
	Ultimately, you should be able to handle our social media presence ensuring high levels of web traffic, engagement and delivering both useful and appealing online information about our company and products.


Responsibilities


	Design and implement social media strategy to align with business goals.
	Generate, edit, publish and share engaging creative content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news) for Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and X.
	Monitor SEO and web traffic metrics.
	Collaborate with other teams, like marketing, sales and customer service to ensure brand consistency.
	Communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews.
	Oversee social media accounts&rsquo; design.
	Suggest and implement new features to develop brand awareness.
	Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools and applications.
	Update content across various social media channels.
	Utilize social media marketing.
	Design and implement social media strategy that aligns with our business goals.
	Set targets to increase brand awareness and increase customer engagement and loyalty.
	Manage and track budgets for social media activities.
	Research on industry-related topics.
	Become an extension of the company&rsquo;s brand to connect with existing customers, and acquire new ones.
	Coordinate with marketing and design teams to illustrate articles.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in English, Communication, Marketing or relevant field.
	At least 3 years of proven work experience as a Social Media Manager.
	Excellent copywriting and editing skills.
	Ability to deliver creative content (text, image and video).
	Solid knowledge of SEO, keyword research, Meta and Google Analytics.
	Knowledge of online marketing channels.
	Experience with paid social media advertising.


Requirements:


	Clear, confident communication abilities.
	Effective time-management skills.
	Significant experience leading a brand&rsquo;s social media initiatives.
	Keen understanding of how to craft effective social media strategies
	Large social media following
	Analytical and multitasking skills
	Understanding of target audience &amp; brand voice
	Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to:&nbsp;ahmresourcehub@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Social Media Manager Job at AHM Resource Hub




        
    

        
        AHM Resource Hub, HR Management & Consulting is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a talented Social Media Manager to help us expand our digital footprint, oversee our social communications efforts and increase brand awareness and affinity.
	The ideal candidate will manage our company image in a cohesive way to achieve our marketing and branding goals. The candidate should be well-versed in the latest digital technologies and social media trends. The candidate should also have in-depth knowledge of SEO, analytics, and content management tools.
	Ultimately, you should be able to handle our social media presence ensuring high levels of web traffic, engagement and delivering both useful and appealing online information about our company and products.


Responsibilities


	Design and implement social media strategy to align with business goals.
	Generate, edit, publish and share engaging creative content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news) for Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and X.
	Monitor SEO and web traffic metrics.
	Collaborate with other teams, like marketing, sales and customer service to ensure brand consistency.
	Communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews.
	Oversee social media accounts’ design.
	Suggest and implement new features to develop brand awareness.
	Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in social media, design tools and applications.
	Update content across various social media channels.
	Utilize social media marketing.
	Design and implement social media strategy that aligns with our business goals.
	Set targets to increase brand awareness and increase customer engagement and loyalty.
	Manage and track budgets for social media activities.
	Research on industry-related topics.
	Become an extension of the company’s brand to connect with existing customers, and acquire new ones.
	Coordinate with marketing and design teams to illustrate articles.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in English, Communication, Marketing or relevant field.
	At least 3 years of proven work experience as a Social Media Manager.
	Excellent copywriting and editing skills.
	Ability to deliver creative content (text, image and video).
	Solid knowledge of SEO, keyword research, Meta and Google Analytics.
	Knowledge of online marketing channels.
	Experience with paid social media advertising.


Requirements:


	Clear, confident communication abilities.
	Effective time-management skills.
	Significant experience leading a brand’s social media initiatives.
	Keen understanding of how to craft effective social media strategies
	Large social media following
	Analytical and multitasking skills
	Understanding of target audience & brand voice
	Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: ahmresourcehub@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development (Core focus :- .NET)",
  "description": "NewGlobe supports visionary governments to transform public education systems, the cornerstone of a prosperous, equitable, and peaceful society. With a comprehensive system transformation platform and data-driven educational services, NewGlobe delivers rapid and dramatic improvements in learning outcomes at state and nationwide scale. Through building impactful partnerships and programmes, NewGlobe ensures that all children have access to an education that will develop their full potential and create a foundation for growth and prosperity.

NewGlobe leverages more than a decade of educational experience and proven impact in integrated school management, teacher professional development, instructional design innovation, technological system support, child-centered classroom practice, and parent engagement -&nbsp; all grounded in learning science - to ensure each teacher is empowered to engage children in transformational learning, and all children have the opportunity to develop to their full potential. Every day, NewGlobe supports governments to solve what were once seen as intractable problems, and by doing so, ensures this generation will be able to grow up to lead more fulfilled lives, while simultaneously building economic prosperity for themselves, their communities, and the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development (Core focus :- .NET)
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development to be part of one of our Lagos-based cross-functional software development teams, helping to build the software that powers our educational offering.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong customer focus, a track record of delivering high-quality products in a continuous delivery environment, and an appreciation for clean and simple code.
	NewGlobe especially values &ldquo;T-shaped&rdquo; team members &ndash; individuals with expertise in a particular area, but an interest in working across all parts of the technology stack and aspects of delivery.


What You Will Do


	Design, implement, and support new products and features.
	Ensure software is built with an eye towards quality, maintainability, and scalability.
	Collaborate with project sponsors to elaborate requirements and facilitate trade-offs that maximise customer value.
	Work with product and development teams to establish overall technical direction and product strategy


What You Should Have


	3+ years of enterprise software development experience in C#, especially .NET Core, and relational databases, especially MS SQL Server and Vue.js in the front end.
	Ability to function well in a fast-paced, informal environment where constant change is the norm and the bar for quality is set high.
	Familiarity with continuous delivery practices and tools (e.g Jenkins, Bamboo, GoCD, Octopus).
	Experience in any of the following areas are a plus (and interest a must):
	
		Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behaviour Driven Development (BDD)
		Cloud environments (esp. AWS) and Containerisation (Docker)
		Web stacks associated with single-page applications (SPAs) and progressive web applications (PWAs)
		Other languages and ecosystems (e.g. NodeJS, Ruby, functional languages, NoSQL DBs)
	
	
	NewGlobe is a strong supporter of open source projects &ndash; familiarity with OSS projects is a plus; contributions to open source projects is a big plus.
",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-03",

Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development (Core focus :- .NET) Job at NewGlobe




        
    

        
        NewGlobe supports visionary governments to transform public education systems, the cornerstone of a prosperous, equitable, and peaceful society. With a comprehensive system transformation platform and data-driven educational services, NewGlobe delivers rapid and dramatic improvements in learning outcomes at state and nationwide scale. Through building impactful partnerships and programmes, NewGlobe ensures that all children have access to an education that will develop their full potential and create a foundation for growth and prosperity.
     

            
    



NewGlobe leverages more than a decade of educational experience and proven impact in integrated school management, teacher professional development, instructional design innovation, technological system support, child-centered classroom practice, and parent engagement -  all grounded in learning science - to ensure each teacher is empowered to engage children in transformational learning, and all children have the opportunity to develop to their full potential. Every day, NewGlobe supports governments to solve what were once seen as intractable problems, and by doing so, ensures this generation will be able to grow up to lead more fulfilled lives, while simultaneously building economic prosperity for themselves, their communities, and the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development (Core focus :- .NET)
Job Location: Lagos

About the Role


	We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer, Software Development to be part of one of our Lagos-based cross-functional software development teams, helping to build the software that powers our educational offering.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong customer focus, a track record of delivering high-quality products in a continuous delivery environment, and an appreciation for clean and simple code.
	NewGlobe especially values “T-shaped” team members – individuals with expertise in a particular area, but an interest in working across all parts of the technology stack and aspects of delivery.


What You Will Do


	Design, implement, and support new products and features.
	Ensure software is built with an eye towards quality, maintainability, and scalability.
	Collaborate with project sponsors to elaborate requirements and facilitate trade-offs that maximise customer value.
	Work with product and development teams to establish overall technical direction and product strategy


What You Should Have


	3+ years of enterprise software development experience in C#, especially .NET Core, and relational databases, especially MS SQL Server and Vue.js in the front end.
	Ability to function well in a fast-paced, informal environment where constant change is the norm and the bar for quality is set high.
	Familiarity with continuous delivery practices and tools (e.g Jenkins, Bamboo, GoCD, Octopus).
	Experience in any of the following areas are a plus (and interest a must):
	
		Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behaviour Driven Development (BDD)
		Cloud environments (esp. AWS) and Containerisation (Docker)
		Web stacks associated with single-page applications (SPAs) and progressive web applications (PWAs)
		Other languages and ecosystems (e.g. NodeJS, Ruby, functional languages, NoSQL DBs)
	
	
	NewGlobe is a strong supporter of open source projects – familiarity with OSS projects is a plus; contributions to open source projects is a big plus.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

	We require the services of Administrative Assistant who is prepared to start work as soon as possible.
	He or she will provide general administrative support duties to the Head of Professional Education and Training.


Requirements


	Candidates should have a minimum educational qualification of Degree or HND in administration-related discipline; be proficient inWord Processing Packages and Applications; have basic general knowledge of Internet Services; in addition to at least 2 years practical experience.

Or
Post or courier delivery to:
The Registrar,
Chartered Institute of Administration,
78, Old Ojo Road (by NAID bus stop),
Kuje Amuwo, Lagos State.",

Administrative Assistant Job at Chartered Institute of Administration




        
    

        
        Chartered Institute of Administration is a Professional and Examining Body Chartered by Act No. 103 of 1992, now Cap C7 LFN 2004; and is empowered to regulate the training in, and practice of Administration within a professional framework throughout Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Amuwo, Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We require the services of Administrative Assistant who is prepared to start work as soon as possible.
	He or she will provide general administrative support duties to the Head of Professional Education and Training.


Requirements


	Candidates should have a minimum educational qualification of Degree or HND in administration-related discipline; be proficient inWord Processing Packages and Applications; have basic general knowledge of Internet Services; in addition to at least 2 years practical experience.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their written application accompanied with their CV detailing their education and career history, as well as copies of their credentials to: info@cia.org.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
Or
Post or courier delivery to:
The Registrar,
Chartered Institute of Administration,
78, Old Ojo Road (by NAID bus stop),
Kuje Amuwo, Lagos State.    

    

        Click here to Apply
